alert.note: Alert for Pulaski (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 23 at 3:23AM CDT until March 25 at 5:26PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Roubidoux Creek Near Waynesville affecting Pulaski County. .Heavy rainfall is expected over the Roubidoux Basin from this afternoon through Friday. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Roubidoux Creek near Waynesville. * WHEN...From Friday morning to Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, the RV Park on the west side of Roubidoux in Waynesville just north of the Business 66 bridge floods. Spring Road near I-44 floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 1.1 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
